intro: Phyla nodiflora var. longifolia, commonly known as the coastal morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in sandy or coastal soils and is commonly found in wetland and estuarine environments. This species is known for its adaptability to saline conditions and its role in stabilizing coastal dunes.
